lines: You've got a goddamn sexy look in your eye,
that defies two thousand years of trying to civilise me.
You've got a crazy taste on your tongue,
just like the allium that sprouted from where the devil stepped out of heaven.
You have a wildness showing in your hair,
that reminds me my God is a wild animal, not a pet that i can tame.
She roams free and i must chase her,
track her down when my faith grows complacent.
We wash our selves in a mountain lake,
then get out and dry in the sun and you run your hands through my hair.
Leave a tuft stuck out of each side,
so even though i feel baptised it looks like two horns there forever.
And i attain to a purity,
so i can present myself naked and unguarded, in front of wild women,
baring steak knives held up high,
but they leave me unscathed after seeing themselves reflected in my eye.
I think that you should embrace me,
because i won't fall apart if i have your strong arms around me.
The more i see of your wild side,
the more i want you to be my– and i be your– ever-loving bride.
Whatever that means,
because you, my God, are a wild animal.
Whatever that means,
because you, my God, are a wild animal.
title: Wild Animal
extended_title: My God is a Wild Animal
